scenario:
The S&P 500 is home to 500 companies from 11 different sectors, with the largest companies having a greater influence over its performance due to market capitalization weighting. The top five companies by market cap, representing 28.8% of the index, are Apple, Nvidia, Microsoft, Alphabet, and Amazon. These companies have seen significant gains in 2024, with an average return of 61%, driven by their efforts in the artificial intelligence (AI) space.

Apple has launched its Apple Intelligence software, which includes AI-powered writing tools and a Siri upgrade. The company's latest chips, designed for processing AI workloads, pave the way for future AI features. Apple devices worldwide total over 2.2 billion, making it a potential major distributor of AI to consumers.

Nvidia is the leading supplier of graphics processors (GPUs) for developing AI, and its new Blackwell GB200 GPUs offer a substantial leap in performance. Demand for Blackwell chips is outstripping supply, and Nvidia is on track to generate a record $128.6 billion in total revenue during fiscal 2025, followed by almost $200 billion in fiscal 2026.

Microsoft has invested $10 billion in OpenAI and launched its own AI virtual assistant, Copilot, which is now embedded in its flagship software products. The company has also launched a portfolio of AI services on its Azure cloud platform. Microsoft has allocated $55.7 billion to capital expenditures during its fiscal 2024, with most of the figure related to AI data centers and chips.

Alphabet has launched its own family of AI models, called Gemini, and a chatbot with the same name. The company is using these models to change how Google Search responds to queries, incorporating text, images, and links to third-party websites. Alphabet says the links within its new AI Overviews feature receive more clicks than traditional search results.

Amazon is integrating AI into the entire customer experience, offering a virtual shopping assistant called Rufus and using a tool called Project Private Investigator inside its fulfillment centers. Amazon Web Services (AWS) wants to dominate the three core layers of AI: data center infrastructure, large language models (LLMs), and software. AWS has designed its own chips, its own family of models called Titan, and its own AI virtual assistant called Q.

The five companies are forecast to spend hundreds of billions of dollars combined in their quest for AI supremacy, which could make them even more influential over the S&P 500.
